intro: Spyridium daltonii, commonly known as Dalton's spyridium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions such as South Australia and Western Australia. Its leaves are usually narrow and grey-green, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Spyridium daltonii is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
